keyTakeAways: Kada Scott's remains were found behind an abandoned school in Philadelphia, confirmed by DNA testing.
Keon King, 21, of Dover, Delaware, has been arrested and charged with kidnapping, stalking, and other offenses related to Scott’s disappearance.
The black Hyundai Accent, reported stolen a day before Scott vanished, was seen at a recreation center near the location of the remains and later found on fire at a junkyard.
King’s cellphone locations and video evidence show connections to Scott’s disappearance and the stolen vehicle’s movements.
DNA tests confirmed Kada Scott’s identity, and prosecutors have stated they believe additional people may have been involved in the incident.
District Attorney Larry Krasner confirmed that homicide charges are likely, though they are not yet filed, and that the investigation is ongoing.
King was previously arrested in another case involving kidnapping and assault, but charges were dropped due to non-appearance of witnesses.
Kada Scott, a 23-year-old woman who worked in an assisted living facility, was remembered by her parents as a person of light and kindness.

summaryOfNewsArticle: The remains of Kada Scott, a 23-year-old woman reported missing in Philadelphia, were discovered in a shallow grave behind an abandoned school, confirmed by DNA testing. Authorities say the discovery was prompted by a new, more specific anonymous tip that led them to re-examine the site. Keon King, a 21-year-old man from Dover, Delaware, has been arrested and charged with kidnapping, stalking, and other crimes related to the disappearance. Evidence including cellphone location data and video footage of a stolen Hyundai Accent—seen at a recreation center the night before Scott went missing—supports King’s involvement. The vehicle was later found on fire and compacted at a junkyard. Prosecutors believe additional individuals may have been involved, and homicide charges are under consideration. King had previously been arrested in a similar case, though charges were dropped due to witness non-appearance. Scott's parents described her as a source of light and kindness, and the case has sparked public attention and emotional reactions.
title: Remains found behind abandoned school belong to missing Philadelphia woman, Kada Scott, officials say
